comments.author: Sam Holsinger

comments.text:
They Couldn't put anymore of the IV drip into me so they took it away and 
yet I could still feel everything, and had a good conversation with the 
dental surgeon about how we both grew up in the same town in Ontario but 
were now in Halifax.  Once they finished, I thanked them, stood up 
immediately and walked out as if I had just had a check up done.  The whole 
group of assistants and the surgeon looked at my like I had 5 heads for 
being solid as a rock after having so much of the IV pumped into me (the 
guy who went before me was still a pile of jello in his chair in his room 
and had been done since I was first brought to my room﻿

comments.author: Xpl1k3R890

comments.text:
I got mine removed 4 days ago. They injected a lot of anesthetic in my 
mouth and then some more after i was squirming with pain during the 
surgery. The  dentist took out my wisdom teeth piece by piece and although 
it was really uncomfortable and moderately painful it was cool to see. I 
felt completely fine afterwards, but the pain on the first day when the 
anesthesia was wearing off was horrible. The taste of my blood and the 
smell made me vomit (which freaked me out). I have no idea why but my 
saliva was extra thick and slimy for the first day and a half to the point 
where it almost felt stringy. After the bleeding stopped the afternoon 
after the surgery though the pain alternated from almost nothing to 
moderate and my nausea went away. Today i moved onto semi-solid food, which 
is nice and the pain in my jaw is alright (feels equivalent to someone 
having punched my jaw hard an hour ago). I had little swelling in my face, 
mostly in the left side of my face now. I hope my stiff jaw doesn't last 
long though... i want to bite into some actual food. :)﻿

comments.author: logan derbyshire

comments.text:
Holy moly I wish I was like them. The only thing I wanted to do was go to 
Wal-Mart and become the live-in Walmart Greeter. Then I cried for 7 hours 
because the dentist never gave me any pain meds so I felt the aftermath of 
my teeth getting ripped out of my mouth. Full force. Some words of wisdom 
guys, if your dentist doesn't give you a prescription for pain 
meds, don't leave thinking it's fine. Because it wont feel fine.  ﻿
